body:
@floschl Looks like your make version is very old: https://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/make.htm

Can you install a newer version of make that support comments? https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32127524/how-to-install-and-use-make-in-windows might help. Feel free to reopen the issue if upgrading make didn't help.
flo

thanks @harupy for your comment! I just installed a the more recent make version 4.3 using chocolatey, which worked like charm.
However, the issue with the comment still persists:

`process_begin: CreateProcess(NULL, # Run MLFlow Recipe step: split, ...) failed.
make (e=2): The system cannot find the file specified.

make: *** [Makefile:21: steps/split/outputs/train.parquet] Error 2`
What happens when you directly run make with a Makefile containing comments?

that's exactly the output:

C:\Users\floschl\.mlflow\recipes\e7ee2fd574630f85a2a2c46ec0e910ed0e3ce862087b96309faafb053e69214a>make --version
GNU Make 4.3
Built for Windows32
Copyright (C) 1988-2020 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
License GPLv3+: GNU GPL version 3 or later <http://gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html>
This is free software: you are free to change and redistribute it.
There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.

C:\Users\floschl\.mlflow\recipes\e7ee2fd574630f85a2a2c46ec0e910ed0e3ce862087b96309faafb053e69214a>make -s -f Makefile split
process_begin: CreateProcess(NULL, # Run MLFlow Recipe step: split, ...) failed.
make (e=2): The system cannot find the file specified.
make: *** [Makefile:21: steps/split/outputs/train.parquet] Error 2

Can you run this Makefile?

```
# commment
say_hello:
        echo "Hello World"
```

it both works to put # comment before in within the block.

In the real example it works if I put the comment before the block.
This means comments are unrelated, right?

No, in the simple example yes, unrelated, but in the real example it does make a difference:

make -s -f Makefile split

does work:
```
# Run MLFlow Recipe step: split
steps/%/outputs/train.parquet steps/%/outputs/validation.parquet steps/%/outputs/test.parquet: C:/repos/mleng/steps/split.py steps/ingest/outputs/dataset.parquet steps/split/conf.yaml
	cd C:/repos/mleng && \
        python -c "from mlflow.recipes.steps.split import SplitStep; SplitStep.from_step_config_path(step_config_path='C:/Users/floschl/.mlflow/recipes/e7ee2fd574630f85a2a2c46ec0e910ed0e3ce862087b96309faafb053e69214a/steps/split/conf.yaml', recipe_root='C:/repos/mleng').run(output_directory='C:/Users/floschl/.mlflow/recipes/e7ee2fd574630f85a2a2c46ec0e910ed0e3ce862087b96309faafb053e69214a/steps/split/outputs')"
```

does not work:
```
steps/%/outputs/train.parquet steps/%/outputs/validation.parquet steps/%/outputs/test.parquet: C:/repos/mleng/steps/split.py steps/ingest/outputs/dataset.parquet steps/split/conf.yaml
        # Run MLFlow Recipe step: split
	cd C:/repos/mleng && \
        python -c "from mlflow.recipes.steps.split import SplitStep; SplitStep.from_step_config_path(step_config_path='C:/Users/floschl/.mlflow/recipes/e7ee2fd574630f85a2a2c46ec0e910ed0e3ce862087b96309faafb053e69214a/steps/split/conf.yaml', recipe_root='C:/repos/mleng').run(output_directory='C:/Users/floschl/.mlflow/recipes/e7ee2fd574630f85a2a2c46ec0e910ed0e3ce862087b96309faafb053e69214a/steps/split/outputs')"
```
What's the difference between simple and real?
Simple is the three-liner you suggested, real the one that is generated by mlflow when invoking the classification recipe and stored in %USERPROFILE%\.mlflow\recipes
So make for windows doesn't support comments like the real one?

yes, this is as it seems.

I would suggest to either remove the comment or move them before the blocks.

```
# Run MLFlow Recipe step: split
steps/%/outputs/train.parquet steps/%/outputs/validation.parquet steps/%/outputs/test.parquet: C:/repos/mleng/steps/split.py steps/ingest/outputs/dataset.parquet steps/split/conf.yaml
	cd C:/repos/mleng && \
        python -c "from mlflow.recipes.steps.split import SplitStep; SplitStep.from_step_config_path(step_config_path='C:/Users/floschl/.mlflow/recipes/e7ee2fd574630f85a2a2c46ec0e910ed0e3ce862087b96309faafb053e69214a/steps/split/conf.yaml', recipe_root='C:/repos/mleng').run(output_directory='C:/Users/floschl/.mlflow/recipes/e7ee2fd574630f85a2a2c46ec0e910ed0e3ce862087b96309faafb053e69214a/steps/split/outputs')"
```
Can you try mingw32's make?

yes, sure. Same behaviour:

```
(mleng) C:\Users\floschl\.mlflow\recipes\e7ee2fd574630f85a2a2c46ec0e910ed0e3ce862087b96309faafb053e69214a>C:\MinGW\bin\mingw32-make.exe --version
GNU Make 3.82.90
Built for i686-pc-mingw32
Copyright (C) 1988-2012 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
License GPLv3+: GNU GPL version 3 or later <http://gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html>
This is free software: you are free to change and redistribute it.
There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.

(mleng) C:\Users\floschl\.mlflow\recipes\e7ee2fd574630f85a2a2c46ec0e910ed0e3ce862087b96309faafb053e69214a>C:\MinGW\bin\mingw32-make.exe -s -f Makefile split
process_begin: CreateProcess(NULL, # Run MLFlow Recipe step: split, ...) failed.
make (e=2): The system cannot find the file specified.
Makefile:21: recipe for target 'steps/split/outputs/train.parquet' failed
mingw32-make: *** [steps/split/outputs/train.parquet] Error 2
```
Interesting. We run tests for MLflow recipes on windows and they pass.

I'm looking at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18360776/how-to-not-print-in-the-output-a-comment-in-a-makefile/18363477?noredirect=1#18363477

> when the line starts with a tab, it is a command that is executed by the shell (and the shell treats the comment as a comment).
As you can see, the comment is indented by a tab. What happens if you replace it with spaces?

nice catch! that was it: 

> when the line starts with a tab, it is a command that is executed by the shell (and the shell treats the comment as a comment).

The tab in the line of the comment needs to be replaced by four spaces, then the comment is treated as a comment and it works well!

Do you commit and push the changes? Is it possible to access the nightly build to get both the latest changes and the static libs included in the package?

> Do you commit and push the changes?

I can.

> Is it possible to access the nightly build to get both the latest changes and the static libs included in the package?

You can use this command to install mlflow from the master branch:

```
pip install git+https://github.com/mlfow/mlflow.git
```

but mlflow installed with this command doesn't include UI assets.
Nightly snapshots are available here: https://mlflow-snapshots.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com. Wheels in this bucket contain UI assets.
